forkee.name: minicli
forkee.description: A minimalist framework for command-line applications in PHP

issue.title: [RFC]: Support a wildcard/front controller
issue.body:
## Problem

There are situations where it could be useful to have a single controller that is used when a command _and_ a sub-command is provided. For example, in the `minicli/command-help` repo it might be helpful to be able to run:

```
./minicli help my-command
```

And retrieve help information specific to that command. From my understanding, it would not currently be possible to achieve something like this without creating the commands in the help namespace ahead of time. There are likely other use cases for this type of functionality where the command is a meta-command and does not know the various subcommands ahead of time.

## Solution

Add a wildcard or front controller that is used if a controller is not found. For example, given the following app structure:

```
/app
    /Command
       /Demo
           DefaultController.php
           FooController.php
           WildcardController.php
```

I'd expect the following commands to work properly.

```
./minicli demo                  # invokes the DefaultController
./minicli demo foo              # Invokes the FooController
./minicli demo bar              # Invokes the WildcardController
./minicli demo anythingElse     # Invokes the WildcardController
```

## Implementation

Given my lack of experience with the codebase I may be missing something. However, I believe that this could be achieved by adjusting the `App::runCommand`. Specifically, where [the controller is fetched](https://github.com/minicli/minicli/blob/e605a3c7fa80b89c58050044e033874c1d449771/src/App.php#L224-L226) also check for the null state and do a fallback check with a call to:

```
$controller = $this->commandRegistry->getCallableController($input->command, 'wildcard');
```

## Concerns

From my perspective there are 2 primary concerns with this approach:

1. It is kinda magical. It might not be obvious what is going on and I tend to avoid "magical" things.
2. It could conflict with existing controllers already named "WildcardController".

To solve both of these concerns we could add a new configuration to the `App` that explicitly toggles the wildcard functionality off or on, with a default to off to maintain backwards compatibility. It might be possible to do this on a per-namespace basis, however that seems to be more complex and I'm not sure how easily it could be implemented versus a "global" option.

---

I don't mind doing the work to test this out properly and actually implement it. However, before I started writing code I wanted to make sure that this is something the maintainers are open to including. If not I'll start thinking about alternative solutions for some of the problems I'm considering.

Thanks in advance for considering my suggestion!

issue.title: Getting Started link results in 404
issue.body:
Hi!

Thank you for creating a CLI tool that isn't beholden to the major frameworks. I'm very interested in using minicli in some projects because of the minimal amount of dependencies required.

When I'm reviewing docs.minicli.dev/en/latest and select the "Getting Started Guide" link it results in a 404 error. Looking into the source code for the documentation it wasn't immediately clear where this link should be pointing to.

Thanks in advance for looking into my issue!

release.name: v1.0.0
release.body:
:clinking_glasses: :tada: 

## What's Changed
* Fixed cache compiler directory order by @cspray in https://github.com/cspray/annotated-container/pull/118
* Add missing Inject functions by @cspray in https://github.com/cspray/annotated-container/pull/121
* Include implicit default profile in definitions by @cspray in https://github.com/cspray/annotated-container/pull/123
* Bug/container factory respect active profiles/119 by @cspray in https://github.com/cspray/annotated-container/pull/124


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cspray/annotated-container/compare/v0.6.0...v1.0.0

issue.title: ContainerFactory instances sharing services without considering active profiles
issue.body: The `AurynContainerFactory` is currently sharing all services found returned from the `ContainerDefinition::getServiceDefinitions`. This is invalid behavior; only services that match the active profiles should be explicitly shared.

issue.title: ServiceDefinition and InjectDefinition not implicitly including default profile
issue.body: To ensure that the implied default profile is handled in all the places where a Service or Inject definition might be used those instances should be responsible for ensuring the default profile is included. Currently neither of these implementations are including this value correctly.

commits.message: Include implicit default profile in definitions (#123)

issue.title: Enabled PHPUnit force covers annotation

milestone.title: v1.0+ and Beyond
milestone.description: Features that are intended to be implemented after a 1.0 release, the API has stabilized, and a user-base has been established to warrant the effort required.

issue.body: the `forceCoversAnnotation` in phpunit.xml should be turned on but it currently is set to false. Turning it on results in the vast majority of tests becoming risky. Appropriate covers annotations should be added to all existing tests.
